intro: Zoroxus, commonly known as the silverleaf spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, thick leaves that are often covered in a waxy, silvery coating, which helps reduce water loss in arid environments. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in a structure called a cyathium, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Zoroxus is native to regions of Africa and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it well adapted to drought conditions, and it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
